tool.name: Predict variant effects

validator.message: No annotation caches are available for the specified build

tool.command:
#if $annotation_cache.source == "custom": #set $custom_ext = $annotation_cache.custom_annotation.ext[:3] set -o pipefail && grep -v "#" '${annotation_cache.custom_annotation}' | LC_ALL=C sort -k1,1 -k4,4n -k5,5n -t$'\t' | bgzip -c > 'custom_annotation.${custom_ext}.gz' && tabix -p gff 'custom_annotation.${custom_ext}.gz' && #end if #if $ref_seq.ref_source == "cached": ln -s '$ref_seq.ref.fields.path' reference.fa && #else if $ref_seq.ref_source == "history": ln -s '$ref_seq.ref' reference.fa && #end if
vep -i '${annotation_cache.input1}' -o MainOutput.vcf --vcf #if $annotation_cache.source == "custom": --$custom_ext 'custom_annotation.${custom_ext}.gz' #else: --cache --species '${annotation_cache.cache_file.fields.species}' --dir_cache '${annotation_cache.cache_file.fields.path}' #if $annotation_cache.cache_file.fields.cachetype == "refseq": --refseq #if $annotation_cache.cache_file.fields.cachetype == "merged": --merged #if $annotation_cache.cache_file.fields.version != "@DB_VERSION@": --cache_version $annotation_cache.cache_file.fields.version ## The --offline flag automatically activates --cache. This is not wanted in our gff/gtf case but also not needed as no internet connection is required for annotating with these custom annotation sources. --offline #end if #if $ref_seq.ref_source != "no_ref" --fasta reference.fa #end if --stats_text
#if $out_opt.sift != "None": --sift $out_opt.sift #if $out_opt.polyphen != "None": --polyphen $out_opt.polyphen #if $out_opt.nearest != "None": --nearest $out_opt.nearest #if int($out_opt.distance_custom.distance_1) > -1: --distance $out_opt.distance_custom.distance_1#if int($out_opt.distance_custom.distance_2) > -1: ,$out_opt.distance_custom.distance_2 #end if #if $out_opt.cell_type != "": --cell_type '$out_opt.cell_type' #if $out_opt.individual != "": --individual $out_opt.individual --vcf_info_field $out_opt.vcf_info_type.vcf_info_field --terms $out_opt.terms #if $out_opt.out_opt_checkboxes != "None": ${' '.join(str($out_opt.out_opt_checkboxes).split(","))} #if $out_opt.shift_var.shift_selector != "None": $out_opt.shift_var.shift_selector #if $out_opt.shift_var.shift_selector == "--shift_hgvs 0 --shift_3prime 1" #if $out_opt.shift_var.shift_length != "None": $out_opt.shift_var.shift_length #end if #end if #if $ident.input_synonyms: --synonyms '${ident.input_synonyms}' #if $ident.ident_checkboxes != "None": ${' '.join(str($ident.ident_checkboxes).split(","))} #if $colo_var.colo_var_checkboxes != "None": ${' '.join(str($colo_var.colo_var_checkboxes).split(","))} #if $fil_qc.fil_qc_checkboxes != "None": ${' '.join(str($fil_qc.fil_qc_checkboxes).split(","))} $plugins.carol $plugins.condel #if $plugins.exacpli_file: --plugin ExACpLI,'${plugins.exacpli_file}' #if $plugins.loftool_file: --plugin LoFtool,'${plugins.loftool_file}'

param.name: source
param.label: Select source of annotation data
param.help: Ensembl strongly recommends to only use annotation cache files with a version number matching the VEP version. You can disable the corresponding filtering of available cache files at your own risk. This does not apply if you select a GFF/GTF annotation source.
param.option: VEP cache file with matching version number
Any VEP cache file
GFF or GTF from history

param.name: cache_file
param.label: Select annotation cache file
param.help: If the annotation data of interest is not listed, have a look at all available cache files regardless of their version number or contact your Galaxy admin.

param.name: cache_file
param.label: Select annotation cache file
param.help: If the annotation data of interest is not listed, contact your Galaxy admin.

param.name: custom_annotation
param.label: Select GFF or GTF annotation file from history
param.help: Choosing this option requires that you also supply a Fasta file as reference genome.

param.name: ref_source
param.label: Use FASTA file as reference sequence (optional)
param.help: Must be specified if using a GFF/GTF annotation source or if fetching HGVS or SPDI notations.
param.option: Do not use extra reference sequence
Locally cached
History

validator.message: A built-in reference genome is not available for the build associated with the selected input file

param.label: Output SIFT prediction
param.help: SIFT predicts whether an amino acid substitution affects protein function based on sequence homology and the physical properties of amino acids.
param.option: Prediction term only
Score only
Both

param.label: Output PolyPhen prediction
param.help: PolyPhen is a tool which predicts possible impact of an amino acid substitution on the structure and function of a human protein using straightforward physical and comparative considerations. VEP uses the humVar score by default.
param.option: Prediction term only
Score only
Both

param.label: Retrieve transcript or gene with nearest TSS to each input variant
param.help: Retrieve the transcript or gene with the nearest protein-coding transcription start site (TSS) to each input variant. Note that the nearest TSS may not belong to a transcript that overlaps the input variant, and more than one may be reported in the case where two are equidistant from the input coordinates.
param.option: Nearest transcript ID
Nearest gene ID
Nearest gene symbol

param.name: distance_custom_selector
param.label: Modify the distance up and/or downstream between a variant and a transcript for which VEP will assign the upstream_gene_variant or downstream_gene_variant consequences
param.help: Default: 5000. Upstream is 5' and downstream 3' direction. (--distance [bp_distance(,downstream_distance_if_different)])
param.option: Default
Custom distance used for both upstream and downstream
Custom upstream distance and different custom downstream distance

param.name: distance_1
param.label: Enter custom upstream and downstream distance

param.name: cell_type
param.label: Report only regulatory regions that are found in the given cell type(s):
param.help: Recommended for advanced users only. Can be a single cell type or a comma-separated list. The functional type in each cell type is reported under CELL_TYPE in the output. (--cell_type)

param.name: individual
param.label: Consider only alternate alleles present in the genotypes of the specified individual(s):
param.help: Enter the individual's IDs as comma-separated list. Individual variant combinations homozygous for the given reference allele will not be reported. Each individual and variant combination is given on a separate line of output. Only works with VCF files containing individual genotype data. (--individual [ind list])

param.name: vcf_info_type_selector
param.label: Change name of the consequences INFO column in VCF output
param.help: Default: CSQ. Use ANN for compatibility with other tools such as snpEff (--vcf_info_field [CSQ|ANN|(other)])
param.option: CSQ
ANN
Custom

param.label: Type of consequence terms to output
param.help: The default used for terms is Sequence Ontology.
param.option: Sequence Ontology (SO)
Display version of SO
NCBI

param.name: shift_selector
param.label: Shift variants to the right
param.option: No shift

3' shift of HGVS notations, causing ambiguous insertions or deletions (typically in repetetive sequence tracts) to be "shifted" to their most 3' possible coordinates (relative to the transcript sequence and strand) before the HGVS notations are calculated (--shift_hgvs 1)
Right align all variants relative to their associated transcripts prior to consequence calculation (--shift_3prime 1)
Right align all variants, including intergenic variants, before consequence calculation and update the Location field (--shift_genomic 1)

param.name: shift_length
param.label: Report the distance each variant has been shifted

param.name: out_opt_checkboxes
param.label: Output option flags
param.option: Ouput variant class (--variant_class)
Retrieve humDiv PolyPhen prediction instead of humVar (--humdiv)
Output overlap between transcript and structural variant (--overlaps)
Indicate if the overlapped gene is associated with a phenotype, disease or trait (--gene_phenotype)
Look for overlaps with regulatory regions (--regulatory)
Force VCF genotypes to be interpreted as phased (--phased)
Identify allele number from VCF input, where 1 = first ALT allele etc. (--allele_number)
Adds the reference allele in the output (--show_ref_allele)
Give cDNA, CDS and protein positions as Position/Length (--total_length)
Output affected exon and intron numbering (--numbers)
Don't URI escape HGVS strings (--no_escape)
Don't overwrite existing CSQ entry in VCF INFO field (--keep_csq)
Don't write header lines in output files (--no_headers)

param.name: input_synonyms
param.label: Load a file of chromosome synonyms
param.help: File should be tab-delimited with the primary identifier in column 1 and the synonym in column 2. Synonyms allow different chromosome identifiers to be used in the input file and any annotation source. (--synonyms [file])

param.name: ident_checkboxes
param.label: Identifier flags
param.option: Add HGVS nomenclature, both coding and protein sequence names, to the ouput (requires FASTA) (--hgvs)
Add genomic HGVS nomenclature based on the input chromosome name (requires FASTA) (--hgvsg)
Add genomic SPDI notation (requires FASTA) (--spdi)
Add version numbers to Ensembl transcript identifiers (--transcript_version)
Add the Ensembl protein identifier to the output where appropriate (--protein)
Add the gene symbol (e.g. HGNC) (where available) to the output (--symbol)
Add the CCDS transcript identifer (where available) to the output (--ccds)
Add best match accessions for translated protein products from three UniProt-related databases (SWISSPROT, TREMBL and UniParc) to the output (--uniprot)
Add the transcript support level for this transcript to the output (only for hg38) (--tsl)
Add the APPRIS isoform annotation for this transcript to the output (only for hg38) (--appris)
Add a flag indicating if the transcript is the canonical transcript for the gene (--canonical)
Add a flag indicating if the transcript is the MANE Select or MANE Plus Clinical transcript for the gene (only for hg38) (--mane)
Add a flag indicating if the transcript is the MANE Select transcript for the gene (only for hg38) (--mane_select)
Output the biotype of the transcript or regulatory feature (--biotype)
Add names of overlapping protein domains to output (--domains)
Output aligned RefSeq mRNA identifier for transcript (--xref_refseq)

param.name: colo_var_checkboxes
param.label: Co-located variants flags
param.option: Check for the existence of known variants that are co-located with the input (--check_existing)
Report all known clinical significance values at the given locus (instead of allele-specific) (--clin_sig_allele 0)
Do not include variants with unknown alleles when checking for co-located variants (--exclude_null_alleles)
When checking for existing variants, compare using coordinates only (--no_check_alleles)
Add the global allele frequency (AF) from 1000 Genomes Phase 3 data for any known co-located variant to the output (--af)
Report the highest allele frequency observed in any population from 1000 genomes, ESP or gnomAD (--max_af)
Add allele frequency from continental populations (AFR,AMR,EAS,EUR,SAS) of 1000 Genomes Phase 3 to the output (--af_1kg)
Include allele frequency from NHLBI-ESP populations (--af_esp)
Include allele frequency from Genome Aggregation Database (gnomAD) exome populations (--af_gnomad)
Include allele frequency from ExAC project populations (--af_exac)
Report Pubmed IDs for publications that cite existing variant (--pubmed)
Report known synonyms for co-located variants (--var_synonyms)
Do not exclude variants that have been flagged as failed when checking for co-located variants (--failed 1)

param.name: fil_qc_checkboxes
param.label: Filtering and QC flags
param.option: Only return consequences that fall in the coding regions of transcripts (--coding_only)
Do not include intergenic consequences in the output (--no_intergenic)

param.name: carol
param.label: Enable Carol plugin
param.help: This plugin calculates the Combined Annotation scoRing toOL (CAROL) score for a missense mutation and adds it to VEP's output. Both the SIFT and PolyPhen-2 scores are required for the calculation, so these two have to be activated in the output options section.

param.name: condel
param.label: Enable Condel plugin
param.help: This plugin calculates the Consensus Deleteriousness (Condel) score for a missense mutation and adds it to VEP's output. Both the SIFT and PolyPhen-2 scores are required for the calculation, so these two have to be activated in the output options section.

param.name: exacpli_file
param.label: Enable ExACpLI plugin by selecting an ExACpLI_values text file
param.help: This plugin calculates the probabililty of a gene being loss-of-function intolerant (pLI) and adds it to VEP's output. The closer pLI is to 1, the more likely the gene is loss-of-function (LoF) intolerant. An ExACpLI_values.txt file is required for usage and it is recommended to use the one provided in the VEP_plugins GitHub repository: https://github.com/Ensembl/VEP_plugins

param.name: loftool_file
param.label: Enable LoFtool plugin by selecting a LoFtool_scores text file
param.help: This plugin calculates LoFtool scores and adds them to VEP's output. LoFtool provides a rank of genic intolerance and consequent susceptibility to disease based on the ratio of Loss-of-function (LoF) to synonymous mutations for each gene in 60,706 individuals from ExAC, adjusting for the gene de novo mutation rate and evolutionary protein conservation. The lower the LoFtool gene score percentile the most intolerant is the gene to functional variation. A LoFtool_scores.txt file is required for usage and it is recommended to use the one provided in the VEP_plugins GitHub repository: https://github.com/Ensembl/VEP_plugins

tool.help: The Ensembl Variant Effect Predictor (VEP) is able to determine the effect of variants (e.g. SNPs, insertions or deletions) on genes, transcripts, protein sequences and regulatory regions. Given the coordinates and nucleotide changes of a variant, it outputs affected genes, the exact location and consequences of the variant as well as known variants matching this one.
